title: Hey, music guys (particularly Ed)
body: Is FL Studio capable of making logins like you do, Ed? Kindred, Zoe, DT Trist, and so on. Been a dream of mine since I was little to be a composer, and I wanna get started on it. My brother bought the fancy version of FL Studio, and it can be installed on multiple computers, so I have it now and I'm goinna learn it -- but can it do orchestra?

replies.body:
Hey Niyumi!

I second Just ChiII in his assessment that it doesn't matter what DAW you use (within reason, of course - certain DAWs that have very specific specialties would be too limited for "general audio and midi production"). 

Outside of the DAW, there is a bunch of software and hardware that play a part in the making of music. That greater ecosystem may include samples (the actual sounds you use, often "multisampled", mapped across the keyboard, so you can play them using the DAW or midi keyboard), a midi controller (keyboard to input music into the sequencer), sound interface, plugins, etc. 

I don't know for sure whether FL Studio can do orchestra, but I can imagine that it does. See what sounds/samples come bundled with it. In time, you may find yourself wanting to expand your palette of sounds to include better or more varied samples. 

If you want to produce orchestral music with a computer, you will need to harm yourself with patience, it's almost like learning how to play an instrument.  Ultimately, what matters most is what YOU have to contribute as a composer - the stories you want to tell, the colors you like, etc. Make sure to cultibate that first and foremost (and study/listen the masters!).

Good luck in your endeavors!

Ed the Conqueror

Hey Ed, 
I have a quick question for you. I am an arranger and composer, still in high school, but it's my dream to be a composer for a video game company so I can combine the things I love. Do you have any tips or ideas on how this is possible or what I should do?

Thanks for the response. ^^

Patience is something I've always been good at, and learning FL Studio has been easier than I thought (so far), my issue is just getting something down that sounds good. I'm so overcritical of myself that it's hard to get ideas flowing. :P

The best cure for being overcritical is to give yourself a window of time in which you are allowed to be critical, but never allow it outside of that time. So for example, do 25 or 50 minutes of work then spend 5 or 10 minutes allowing yourself to think about it critically. That way you're not just trying to stifle the impulse, but you channel it to allow yourself more time to get work done before it takes over.
Haha, my brain doesn't let me do that. :P The nagging is just always there, even if I try to ignore it.

I'm sorry, my GF deals with that too. Not sure how to help you there, I haven't been able to help her with it yet either.

Maybe meditiation and mindfulness would help? And not mindfulness as a concept, but the actual practice of it. It's a thing having to do with meditation, you should look it up there are a variety of benefits to practicing it.
It doesn't matter what DAW you use. It's just whether or not how well you know how to use it and you're capability as a composer. FL Studio should work fine.
